oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photograph of the Old Hickory Hospital
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Located just inside the Powder Plant perimeter fence, east of the DuPont Power House, the hospital provided service to the community, augmented by three first aid stations. During the flu epidemic of 1918 other buildings were quickly constructed behind the hospital accommodate the overflow of patients needing care. The US Army contracted with DuPont to construct and operate the gunpowder plant. The area included worker housing and other support structures like the hospital.
